title: 108_hr2095
content:
The Act titled "Comprehensive Insurance Coverage of Childhood Immunization Act of 2003" mandates comprehensive coverage for childhood immunization by group health plans and health insurance issuers. This includes amendments to the Public Health Service Act to ensure standard coverage of childhood immunization. The Act mandates comprehensive coverage for routine immunizations for individuals under 19 years of age by group health plans and health insurance issuers. Coverage includes vaccines without deductibles or coinsurance as per the Recommended Childhood Immunization Schedule. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include a new section. SEC. 714. STANDARD RELATING TO COVERAGE OF CHILDHOOD IMMUNIZATION. SEC. 714 of the Act requires group health plans and health insurance issuers to provide comprehensive coverage for routine immunizations for dependents under 19 years of age without cost-sharing, following the Recommended Childhood Immunization Schedule. Section 714 of the Act mandates coverage for routine immunizations for dependents under 19 years of age without cost-sharing. Additionally, section 1 is amended to include a new item after section 713. Section 714 of the Act mandates coverage for childhood immunization in individual health insurance plans. This new standard ensures that the same coverage requirements apply to individual market plans as they do to group health plans. Coordination of administration is also addressed in Section 3. SEC. 3. COORDINATION OF ADMINISTRATION.

The Secretaries of Health and Human Services and Labor will ensure regulations are administered consistently and coordinate enforcement policies to avoid duplication of efforts.

SEC. 4. EFFECTIVE DATES. The amendments made by section 2 apply to group health plans starting January 1, 2004, and individual health insurance coverage in the individual market on or after that date. There is an exception for group health plans under collective bargaining agreements ratified before the Act's enactment. Any plan amendment made pursuant to a collective bargaining agreement relating to the plan which amends the plan solely to conform to any requirement added by section 2(a) shall not be treated as a termination of such collective bargaining agreement.
